chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This plugin provides a simple parser for diff files (aka patch files) in unified and context format. It shows the paths of diffed files in the structure tree.

chapter.title: The structure tree
chapter.para: The structure tree shows the full file paths in the same order as they appear in the diff file.
If changes range over two files, both files will be shown with a > between them. If the new file is in the same directory as the original, only its filename will be displayed.
Created or deleted files will be prepended with + and - respectively.

itemizedlist.para: Git diff format extensions are recognized (in unified diff format):

listitem.para: Path prefixes a/ and b/ will be removed from original and new file.
A path /dev/null will be interpreted as indicating file creation or deletion.

itemizedlist.para: This very simple parser is written for real-world diff files and does not handle possible but unusual situations:

listitem.para: Path separators are expected to be POSIX-style forward slashes ("/").
The first header line must contain the original file. The new file must be on the next line.
A file path on a preceding Index: line is not used if no other path information is available. (As opposed to the patch tool).
The parser does not check if a file is actually a git diff. This may have unexpected side effects if directories are named a and b.
